metadata.title: CVE-2020-9760 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in WeeChat before 2.7.1 (0.3.4 to 2.7 areaffected). When a new IRC message 005 is received with longer nickprefixes, a buffer overflow and possibly a crash can happen when a new modeis set for a nick.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

weechat - 2.7.1-1
weechat-core - 2.7.1-1
weechat-curses - 2.7.1-1
weechat-guile - 2.7.1-1
weechat-headless - 2.7.1-1
weechat-lua - 2.7.1-1
weechat-perl - 2.7.1-1
weechat-php - 2.7.1-1
weechat-plugins - 2.7.1-1
weechat-python - 2.7.1-1
weechat-ruby - 2.7.1-1
weechat-tcl - 2.7.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: weechat package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.1-1').
